results.title: Madarrpa funeral at Gurka'wuy
results.brief_description: In the small Aboriginal community of Gurka’wuy, 170 kms. south of Yirrkala, a baby dies. Subtitled “a way of coping with death in north-east Arnhem Land through ties of clan, religion and land”, this film, photographed by Dean Semler, depicts the three day long preparations for the funeral, and the funeral itself. The ceremonies, dances, songs and paintings are described in detail, as the child is symbolically returned to its clan lands further south.

results.title: The Big Steal
results.creator_credit: Nadia Tass, David Parker, Timothy White and Cascade Films
results.brief_description: Danny (Ben Mendelsohn) wants two things in his life: a Jaguar car and a relationship with the beautiful Joanna (Claudia Karvan).

constellations_other.name: Nadia Tass
constellations_other.description: Comedic and cult classics take centre stage in Nadia Tass' career.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Nadia Tass, David Parker, Timothy White and Cascade Films
results.description: Danny (Ben Mendelsohn) wants two things in his life: a Jaguar car and a relationship with the beautiful Joanna (Claudia Karvan). A shonky car dealer, Farkas, takes Danny for a ride by selling him a Jaguar with a disaster area where the engine should be. But Danny manages to get his revenge on the sleazy Farkas as well as getting his dream date with Joanna. The inconsequential plot is secondary to the affectionate characterisation of the Western suburbs community in which Danny lives. The excellent cast also includes Steve Bisley.

results.title: Jesus of Nazareth
results.creator_credit: Franco Zeffirelli, Vincenzo Labella, ITC and Radiotelevisione Italiana
results.brief_description: Director Franco Zeffirelli’s powerful and compelling epic traces the life of Jesus of Nazareth from Immaculate Conception through to Divine Resurrection. Critically acclaimed and lauded by religious leaders worldwide, a distinguished cast supports Robert Powell and Olivia Hussey in the leading roles of Jesus and Mary.

results.title: The Wonderful world of dogs
results.creator_credit: Mark Lewis, ABC-TV (Australia), Australian Film Commission, Channel 4 and Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: 540,000 dogs inhabit the city of Sydney and every one with a story to tell. This whimsical, humorous film tells some of them, and in particular, the story of Fugly, the most impounded dog in Australia, and his impact on the suburb of Mosman. Dog lovers and dog haters alike express their point of view as we watch Fugly roaming the streets. “Some dogs just want to be dogs. Some people want dogs to be people. But dogs will be dogs … and people will be people. We all live together.”

results.title: The Huge adventures of Trevor a cat; Trevor Island
results.creator_credit: John Taylor and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: A combination of two animated films by John Taylor. “The Huge adventures of Trevor, a cat”. Trevor has his hunting instincts revived when he accidentally catches a bird. Encouraged by his success Trevor sets his sights even higher with disastrous and hilarious results. “Trevor Island” Trevor’s family move to a tropical island and decide to set up an airport and car park. A sedate lifestyle, however, is not to Trevor’s liking.

results.title: Jewel of the Nile (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Lewis Teague, Michael Douglas and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Thrill-packed sequel to “Romancing the Stone”. It’s been six months since Joan Wilder (Kathleen Turner) and Jack Colton (Michael Douglas) sailed into the sunset after their first adventure - but it hasn’t all been smooth sailing. Then they learn of the mysterious, priceless Jewel of the Nile, and it’s non-stop excitement as they race to beat villainous Danny de Vito to the treasure.

results.title: Girls, girls, girls (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Norman Taurog, Hal B. Wallis and Wallis-Hazen
results.brief_description: Over a dozen Hollywood leading ladies, including Stella Stevens, star with Elvis Presley in this lighthearted musical about a nightclub singer who runs a fishing boat as a hobby. Songs featured include ‘Return to Sender’, ‘I Don’t Want To’, ‘Because of Love’ and ‘Song of the Shrimp’.

results.title: Three fugitives (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Francis Veber, Lauren Shuler and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: Nick Nolte plays a tough ex-con, fresh out of prison, who is trapped in a bank and held hostage by a bungling, first-time holdup man (Martin Short). No one will believe Nolte’s innocence and no one can believe Short’s guilt, so the unlikely duo become partners in crime - and parenting, when Short’s six year old daughter joins the fugitives on a wheel-screeching run for the Canadian border. An American version of the successful French film of the same name.

results.title: The Plant
results.creator_credit: Thomas Vamos, Helene Verrier and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A live-action non-narrated story about a man who brings a plant, that had been struggling up through a crack in the pavement, into his apartment. The plant is lavished with kindness by its new owner, but has a mind of its own and soon grows out of control. It encroaches into all areas of the apartment, eventually damaging it beyond repair. An open-ended film allowing scope for language development.

results.title: Tadpoles and frogs
results.brief_description:
Captures the transformation of a tadpole into a frog. Covers each stage of development from observation and hatching of the tiny frog eggs up through the development of hind limbs and forelimbs.
Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
